intro: Trisetella lasiochila, commonly known as the woolly trisetella, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheats and other related plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy, or pubescent, stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Trisetella lasiochila is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices.
